subject: Sexual Health
title: How Failure Rates Are Measured
description: A fast breakdown of How Failure Rates Are Measured for builders.

hook.text: A 2% failure rate sounds low, but it means 2 out of every 100 users will get pregnant within a year.

buildup.text: Researchers track large groups of people using each method and count pregnancies over 12 months.

discovery.text: The Pearl Index divides pregnancies by total months of use, giving a standardized comparison across methods.

twist.text: Failure rates compound over time. A 9% annual rate means nearly 40% will conceive within five years.

climax.text: Understanding cumulative risk helps people make realistic long-term decisions about contraception.

punchline.text: Small annual risks add up over many years.

quiz.question: What does the Pearl Index measure?
